member.summary: Enrollment service (online CA).

member.summary: ADCS Certificate Template

member.summary: Default constructor

member.summary: The object ID of the certificate template

member.summary: The major of this certificate template

member.summary: The minor of this certificate template

member.name: P:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.AdcsCertificateTemplate.SchemaVersion
member.summary: The certificate template version. Version 1 = Compatible with Windows 2000 and up, Version 2 = WS2003 and up, and so on.

member.name: P:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.AdcsCertificateTemplate.KeyUsages
member.summary: The list of key usages asserted by certificates issued using this certificate template

member.name: P:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.AdcsCertificateTemplate.EnhancedKeyUsages
member.summary: The enhanced key usages asserted by the certificate template

member.name: P:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.AdcsCertificateTemplate.CriticalExtensions
member.summary: Critical extensions asserted by the template

member.name: P:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.AdcsCertificateTemplate.RASignaturesRequired
member.summary: The number of certificate request agents a certificate request must be signed by in order to obtain a certificate using this template

member.name: P:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.AdcsCertificateTemplate.MinimumPublicKeyLength
member.summary: The minimum key size of the public key enforced by this certificate template

member.name: P:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.AdcsCertificateTemplate.ValidityPeriod
member.summary: The amount of time for which certificates issued from this template are valid

member.name: P:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.AdcsCertificateTemplate.PrivateKeyFlags
member.summary: Private key flags

member.summary: General certificate template flags

member.name: P:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.AdcsCertificateTemplate.SubjectNameFlags
member.summary: Certificate template subject name flags

member.name: P:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.AdcsCertificateTemplate.EnrollmentFlags
member.summary: Certificate Template Enrollment flags

member.name: P:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.AdcsCertificateTemplate.KeyAttestationMethods
member.summary: Key attestation methods

member.name: P:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.AdcsCertificateTemplate.KeyArchivalRequired
member.summary: Indicates whether the certificate template requires the CA to archive the subject's private key

member.name: P:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.AdcsCertificateTemplate.ExportablePrivateKey
member.summary: Indicates whether the private key associated with certificates issued from this template should be exportable from the host on which they were created (only meaningful on Windows clients)

member.name: P:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.AdcsCertificateTemplate.RequiresStrongKeyProtection
member.summary: Indicates whether this certificate template should enforce strong private key protection. See https://tinyurl.com/y25l2h8p for more details.

member.name: P:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.AdcsCertificateTemplate.IsOffline
member.summary: If true, the template requires that the enrollee supply the subject information in the certificate request

member.name: P:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.AdcsCertificateTemplate.KeyAttestationEnforcement
member.summary: Indicates whether or how key attestation is enforced by the template

member.name: P:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.AdcsCertificateTemplate.AssertsKeyAttestationPolicy
member.summary: Indicates whether this certificate template requires the CA to assert a TPM Key Attestation issuance policy OID on issued certificates

member.name: P:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.AdcsCertificateTemplate.MinimumSupportedClient
member.summary: Minimum Client OS that can request against this template

member.name: P:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.AdcsCertificateTemplate.MinimumSupportedServer
member.summary: Minimum Server OS where ADCS can issue against this template

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.AdcsCertificateTemplate.AssignedEnrollmentServices
member.summary: The transient Ids of the issuing CAs to which this template is assigned.

member.name: P:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.AdcsCertificateTemplate.AccessRules
member.summary: The collection of AD identity principals that have rights on the certificate template along with the specification of what those rights are

member.name: M:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.AdcsCertificateTemplate.SetAssignedEnrollmentServices(System.Collections.Generic.List{EasyPKIView.EnrollmentServices.AdcsEnrollmentService})
member.summary: Sets the list of ids of enrollment services to which this template is assigned.

member.summary: Gets the list of enrollment services to which this template is assigned.
member.param: The list of enrollment services published in Active Directory.
member.returns: The list of enrollment services to which this template is assigned.

member.name: M:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.AdcsCertificateTemplate.GetAllFromDirectory
member.summary: Gets all certificate templates which exist in the current Active Directory forest.

member.name: T:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateAccessFlags
member.summary:
Defines certificate template enrollment flags.
This enumeration has a attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateAccessFlags.None
member.summary: No rights.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateAccessFlags.Read
member.summary: Read permissions

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateAccessFlags.Write
member.summary: Write permissions

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateAccessFlags.FullControl
member.summary: Full control.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateAccessFlags.Enroll
member.summary: Enroll permission.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateAccessFlags.Autoenroll
member.summary: Autoenroll permission

member.name: T:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateEnrollmentFlags
member.summary:
Defines certificate template enrollment flags.
This enumeration has a attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateEnrollmentFlags.None
member.summary: None.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateEnrollmentFlags.IncludeSymmetricAlgorithms
member.summary: This flag instructs the client and server to include a Secure/Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (S/MIME) certificate extension, as specified in RFC4262, in the request and in the issued certificate.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateEnrollmentFlags.CAManagerApproval
member.summary: This flag instructs the CA to put all requests in a pending state.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateEnrollmentFlags.KraPublish
member.summary: This flag instructs the CA to publish the issued certificate to the key recovery agent (KRA) container in Active Directory.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateEnrollmentFlags.DsPublish
member.summary: This flag instructs clients and CA servers to append the issued certificate to the userCertificate attribute, as specified in RFC4523, on the user object in Active Directory.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateEnrollmentFlags.AutoenrollmentCheckDsCert
member.summary: This flag instructs clients not to do autoenrollment for a certificate based on this template if the user's userCertificate attribute (specified in RFC4523) in Active Directory has a valid certificate based on the same template.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateEnrollmentFlags.Autoenrollment
member.summary: This flag instructs clients to perform autoenrollment for the specified template.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateEnrollmentFlags.ReenrollExistingCert
member.summary: This flag instructs clients to sign the renewal request using the private key of the existing certificate.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateEnrollmentFlags.RequireUserInteraction
member.summary: This flag instructs the client to obtain user consent before attempting to enroll for a certificate that is based on the specified template.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateEnrollmentFlags.RemoveInvalidFromStore
member.summary: This flag instructs the autoenrollment client to delete any certificates that are no longer needed based on the specific template from the local certificate storage.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateEnrollmentFlags.AllowEnrollOnBehalfOf
member.summary: This flag instructs the server to allow enroll on behalf of (EOBO) functionality.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateEnrollmentFlags.IncludeOcspRevNoCheck
member.summary:
This flag instructs the server to not include revocation information and add the id-pkix-ocsp-nocheck extension, as specified in RFC2560 section §4.2.2.2.1, to the certificate that is issued.
Windows Server 2003 - this flag is not supported.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateEnrollmentFlags.ReuseKeyTokenFull
member.summary:
This flag instructs the client to reuse the private key for a smart card–based certificate renewal if it is unable to create a new private key on the card.
Windows XP, Windows Server 2003 - this flag is not supported.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateEnrollmentFlags.NoRevocationInformation
member.summary:
This flag instructs the server to not include revocation information in the issued certificate.
Windows Server 2003, Windows Server 2008 - this flag is not supported.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateEnrollmentFlags.BasicConstraintsInEndEntityCerts
member.summary:
This flag instructs the server to include Basic Constraints extension in the end entity certificates.
Windows Server 2003, Windows Server 2008 - this flag is not supported.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateEnrollmentFlags.IgnoreEnrollOnReenrollment
member.summary:
This flag instructs the CA to ignore the requirement for Enroll permissions on the template when processing renewal requests.
Windows Server 2003, Windows Server 2008, Windows Server 2008 R2 - this flag is not supported.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateEnrollmentFlags.IssuancePoliciesFromRequest
member.summary:
This flag indicates that the certificate issuance policies to be included in the issued certificate come from the request rather than from the template. The template contains a list of all of the issuance policies that the request is allowed to specify; if the request contains policies that are not listed in the template, then the request is rejected.
Windows Server 2003, Windows Server 2008, Windows Server 2008 R2 - this flag is not supported.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateEnrollmentFlags.SkipAutoRenewal
member.summary: This flag instructs autoenrollment client to not renew certificate although the certificate meets all conditions for automatic renewal, i.e. initial automatic certificate enrollment is enabled and subsequent renewal is disabled.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateEnrollmentFlags.DoNotIncludeSidExtension
member.summary: Instructs Enterprise CA to not include SID extension in issued certificates that use subject construction from Active Directory. More information in KB5014754

member.name: T:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateExtension`1
member.summary: Certificate template extension.

member.name: P:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateExtension`1.Oid
member.summary: The OID of this extension.

member.name: P:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateExtension`1.Value
member.summary: The value of this extension.

member.name: P:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateExtension`1.IsCritical
member.summary: Indicates whether this extension is critical or not.

member.name: T:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateFlags
member.summary:
Defines the general-enrollment flags.
This enumeration has a attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateFlags.None
member.summary: None.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateFlags.EnrolleeSuppliesSubject
member.summary: The certificate subject is supplied in the request.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateFlags.AddEmail
member.summary: The subject's Email address must be included in the certificate Only applicable if the subject is built from directory

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateFlags.AddObjectIdentifier
member.summary: This flag is reserved and not used.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateFlags.DsPublish
member.summary: The issued certificate must be published to the subject's directory entry.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateFlags.AllowKeyExport
member.summary: (Windows only) The private key is exportable.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateFlags.Autoenrollment
member.summary: This flag indicates whether clients can perform autoenrollment for the specified template.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateFlags.MachineType
member.summary: The end-entity is a computer.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateFlags.IsCA
member.summary: The end-entity is a certification authority.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateFlags.AddDirectoryPath
member.summary: Adds requester distinguished name.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateFlags.AddTemplateName
member.summary: This flag indicates that a certificate based on this section needs to include a template name certificate extension.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateFlags.AddSubjectDirectoryPath
member.summary: Adds requester distinguished name.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateFlags.IsCrossCA
member.summary: This flag indicates a certificate request for cross-certifying a certificate.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateFlags.DoNotPersistInDB
member.summary:
This flag indicates that the record of a certificate request for a certificate that is issued need not be persisted by the CA.
Windows Server 2003, Windows Server 2008 - this flag is not supported.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateFlags.IsDefault
member.summary: This flag indicates that the template SHOULD not be modified in any way.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateFlags.IsModified
member.summary: This flag indicates that the template MAY be modified if required.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateFlags.IsDeleted
member.summary: N/A

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateFlags.PolicyMismatch
member.summary: N/A

member.name: T:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateNameFlags
member.summary:
Defines flags that determine how certificate subject is constructed.
This enumeration has a attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateNameFlags.EnrolleeSuppliesSubject
member.summary: This flag instructs the client to supply subject information in the certificate request.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateNameFlags.OldCertSuppliesSubjectAndAltName
member.summary:
This flag instructs the client to reuse values of subject name and alternative subject name extensions from an existing valid certificate when creating a certificate renewal request.
Windows Server 2003, Windows Server 2008 - this flag is not supported.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateNameFlags.EnrolleeSuppluiesAltSubject
member.summary: This flag instructs the client to supply subject alternate name information in the certificate request.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateNameFlags.AltSubjectRequireDomainDNS
member.summary: This flag instructs the CA to add the value of the requester FQDN and NetBIOS name to the Subject Alternative Name extension of the issued certificate.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateNameFlags.AltSubjectRequireSPN
member.summary: This flag instructs the CA to add the value of the requester Service Principal name to the Subject Alternative Name extension of the issued certificate.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateNameFlags.AltSubjectRequireDirectoryGUID
member.summary: This flag instructs the CA to add the value of the objectGUID attribute from the requester user object in Active Directory to the Subject Alternative Name extension of the issued certificate.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateNameFlags.AltSubjectRequireUPN
member.summary: This flag instructs the CA to add the value of the UPN attribute from the requester user object in Active Directory to the Subject Alternative Name extension of the issued certificate.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateNameFlags.AltSubjectRequireEmail
member.summary: This flag instructs the CA to add the value of the e-mail attribute from the requester user object in Active Directory to the Subject Alternative Name extension of the issued certificate.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateNameFlags.AltSubjectRequireDNS
member.summary: This flag instructs the CA to add the value obtained from the DNS attribute of the requester user object in Active Directory to the Subject Alternative Name extension of the issued certificate.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateNameFlags.SubjectRequireDNSasCN
member.summary: This flag instructs the CA to add the value obtained from the DNS attribute of the requester user object in Active Directory as the CN in the subject of the issued certificate.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateNameFlags.SubjectRequireEmail
member.summary: This flag instructs the CA to add the value of the e-mail attribute from the requester user object in Active Directory as the subject of the issued certificate.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateNameFlags.SubjectRequireCommonName
member.summary: This flag instructs the CA to set the subject name to the requester CN from Active Directory.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.CertificateTemplateNameFlags.SubjectRequireDirectoryPath
member.summary: This flag instructs the CA to set the subject name to the requester distinguished name (DN) from Active Directory.

member.name: T:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageExtension
member.summary: Enhanced key usage extension

member.name: M:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageExtension.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: M:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageExtension.#ctor(EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags)
member.summary: This constructor accepts enhanced key usage flags.

member.name: P:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageExtension.Custom
member.summary: The list of custom enhanced key usage OIDs.

member.name: T:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags
member.summary:
Defines flags that determine how certificate subject is constructed.
This enumeration has a attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.None
member.summary: None.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.ClientAuthentication
member.summary: The certificate can be used for authenticating a client.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.ServerAuthentication
member.summary: The certificate can be used for server authentication.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.SecureEmail
member.summary: The certificate can be used to encrypt email messages.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.EFS
member.summary: The certificate can be used to encrypt files by using the Encrypting File System (EFS).

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.SmartcardLogon
member.summary: The certificate enables an individual to log on to a computer by using a smart card.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.CodeSigning
member.summary: The certificate can be used for signing code.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.OCSPResponseSigning
member.summary: The certificate can be used for Online Certificate Status Protocol (OCSP) signing.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.CAExchange
member.summary: The certificate can be used for archiving a private key on a certification authority.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.CTLSigning
member.summary: The certificate can be used to sign a Certificate Trust List (CTL).

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.DocumentSigning
member.summary: The certificate can be used for signing documents.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.EFSDataRecovery
member.summary: The certificate can be used for recovery of documents protected by using Encrypting File System (EFS).

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.KeyRecovery
member.summary: The certificate can be used to encrypt and recover escrowed keys.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.KeyRecoveryAgent
member.summary: The certificate is used to identify a key recovery agent.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.LifetimeSigning
member.summary: Limits the validity period of a signature to the validity period of the certificate. This restriction is typically used with the XCN_OID_PKIX_KP_CODE_SIGNING OID value to indicate that new time stamp semantics should be used.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.QualifiedSubordination
member.summary: The certificate can be used to sign cross certificate and subordinate certification authority certificate requests. Qualified subordination is implemented by applying basic constraints, certificate policies, and application policies. Cross certification typically requires policy mapping.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.WindowsNTEmbeddedCryptography
member.summary: The certificate can be used for Windows NT Embedded cryptography.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.TimestampSigning
member.summary: The certificate can be used to sign a time stamp to be added to a document. Time stamp signing is typically part of a time stamping service.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.LicenseServerVerification
member.summary: The certificate can be used by a license server when transacting with Microsoft to receive licenses for Terminal Services clients

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.KeyPackLicenses
member.summary: The certificate can be used for key pack licenses.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.OemWindowsSystemComponentVerification
member.summary: The certificate can be used for used for Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEM) Windows Hardware Quality Labs (WHQL) cryptography.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.CTLAutoenrollment
member.summary: The certificate can be used to sign a request for automatic enrollment in a certificate trust list (CTL).

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.CertificateEnrollmentAgent
member.summary: The certificate can be used by an enrollment agent.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.DSEmailReplication
member.summary: The certificate can be used for Directory Service email replication.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.IPSec
member.summary: The certificate can be used for signing end-to-end Internet Protocol Security (IPSEC) communication.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.IPSecTunnel
member.summary: The certificate can be used for singing IPSEC communication in tunnel mode.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.IPSecUser
member.summary: The certificate can be used for an IPSEC user.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.IKEIntermediate
member.summary: The certificate can be used for Internet Key Exchange (IKE).

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.DRMSigning
member.summary: The certificate can be used for digital rights management applications.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.PKITimestampSigning
member.summary: The certificate can be used for signing public key infrastructure timestamps.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.CertificateRootListSigning
member.summary: The certificate can be used sign a certificate root list.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.WindowsHardwareDriverVerification
member.summary: The certificate can be used for Windows Hardware Quality Labs (WHQL) cryptography.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.EnhancedKeyUsageFlags.Any
member.summary: The certificate can be used for any purpose

member.name: T:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.KeyAttestationEnforcement
member.summary: Indicates whether or how key attestation is enforced by the template

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.KeyAttestationEnforcement.None
member.summary: None.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.KeyAttestationEnforcement.Preferred
member.summary: Key attestation is preferred but not required.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.KeyAttestationEnforcement.Required
member.summary: Key attestation is required. If the CA or client is incapable of key attestation, the request will be denied.

member.name: T:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.KeyAttestationMethodFlags
member.summary:
Indicates what key attestation will be performed based on.
This enumeration has a attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.KeyAttestationMethodFlags.None
member.summary: None.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.KeyAttestationMethodFlags.TrustOnUse
member.summary: This flag indicates that attestation based on the user's credentials is to be performed.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.KeyAttestationMethodFlags.ValidateCert
member.summary: This flag indicates that attestation based on the hardware certificate of the Trusted Platform Module (TPM) is to be performed.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.KeyAttestationMethodFlags.ValidateKey
member.summary: This flag indicates that attestation based on the hardware key of the TPM is to be performed.

member.name: T:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.KeyUsageExtension
member.summary: Key usage extension

member.name: M:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.KeyUsageExtension.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: M:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.KeyUsageExtension.#ctor(System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509KeyUsageFlags)
member.summary: This constructor accepts

member.name: T:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.PrivateKeyFlags
member.summary:
Defines private key configuration settings in certificate templates.
This enumeration has a attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.PrivateKeyFlags.None
member.summary: This flag indicates that attestation data is not required when creating the certificate request. It also instructs the server to not add any attestation OIDs to the issued certificate.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.PrivateKeyFlags.RequireKeyArchival
member.summary: This flag instructs the client to create a key archival certificate request.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.PrivateKeyFlags.AllowKeyExport
member.summary: This flag instructs the client to allow other applications to copy the private key to a .pfx file at a later time.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.PrivateKeyFlags.RequireStrongProtection
member.summary: This flag instructs the client to use additional protection for the private key.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.PrivateKeyFlags.RequireAlternateSignatureAlgorithm
member.summary: This flag instructs the client to use an alternate signature format.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.PrivateKeyFlags.ReuseKeysRenewal
member.summary:
This flag instructs the client to use the same key when renewing the certificate.
Windows Server 2003, Windows Server 2008, Windows Server 2008 R2 - this flag is not supported.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.PrivateKeyFlags.UseLegacyProvider
member.summary:
This flag instructs the client to process the msPKI-RA-Application-Policies attribute.
Windows Server 2003, Windows Server 2008, Windows Server 2008 R2 - this flag is not supported.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.PrivateKeyFlags.TrustOnUse
member.summary: This flag indicates that attestation based on the user's credentials is to be performed.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.PrivateKeyFlags.ValidateCert
member.summary: This flag indicates that attestation based on the hardware certificate of the Trusted Platform Module (TPM) is to be performed.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.PrivateKeyFlags.ValidateKey
member.summary: This flag indicates that attestation based on the hardware key of the TPM is to be performed.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.PrivateKeyFlags.AttestationPreferred
member.summary: This flag informs the client that it SHOULD include attestation data if it is capable of doing so when creating the certificate request. It also instructs the server that attestation might or might not be completed before any certificates can be issued.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.PrivateKeyFlags.AttestationRequired
member.summary: This flag informs the client that attestation data is required when creating the certificate request. It also instructs the server that attestation must be completed before any certificates can be issued.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.PrivateKeyFlags.AttestationWithoutPolicy
member.summary: This flag instructs the server to not add any certificate policy OIDs to the issued certificate even though attestation SHOULD be performed.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.PrivateKeyFlags.Server2003
member.summary: This template is supported by Windows Server 2003 CA server or newer.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.PrivateKeyFlags.Server2008
member.summary: This template is supported by Windows Server 2008 CA server or newer.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.PrivateKeyFlags.Server2008R2
member.summary: This template is supported by Windows Server 2008 R2 CA server or newer.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.PrivateKeyFlags.Server2012
member.summary: This template is supported by Windows Server 2012 CA server or newer.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.PrivateKeyFlags.Server2012R2
member.summary: This template is supported by Windows Server 2012 R2 CA server or newer.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.PrivateKeyFlags.Server2016
member.summary:
This template is supported by Windows Server 2016 CA server or newer.
Note: this template is not supported by Enrollment Web Services.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.PrivateKeyFlags.HelloLogonKey
member.summary: This flag indicates that the key is used for Windows Hello logon.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.PrivateKeyFlags.ClientXP
member.summary: This template is supported by Windows XP/Windows Server 2003 client or newer.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.PrivateKeyFlags.ClientVista
member.summary: This template is supported by Windows Vista/Windows Server 2008 client or newer.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.PrivateKeyFlags.ClientWin7
member.summary: This template is supported by Windows 7/Windows Server 2008 R2 client or newer.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.PrivateKeyFlags.ClientWin8
member.summary: This template is supported by Windows 8/Windows Server 2012 client or newer.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.PrivateKeyFlags.ClientWin81
member.summary: This template is supported by Windows 8.1/Windows Server 2012 R2 client or newer.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.CertificateTemplates.PrivateKeyFlags.ClientWin10
member.summary:
This template is supported by Windows 10/Windows Server 2016 client or newer.
Note: this template is not supported by Enrollment Web Services.

member.name: T:EasyPKIView.EnrollmentServices.EnrollmentServiceFlags
member.summary:
Defines the general-enrollment flags.
This enumeration has a attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

member.summary: None.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.EnrollmentServices.EnrollmentServiceFlags.Unknown
member.summary: Unclear what this bit position does, but it appears to always be set.

member.name: F:EasyPKIView.EnrollmentServices.EnrollmentServiceFlags.IsEnterprise
member.summary: Indicates that the enrollment service is an Enterprise CA.
